title: 114_hr5825
content: The Act is titled the "Illegal Alien Capture Notification Act" and it involves information sharing regarding criminal aliens. Section 642 of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996 is amended to update the responsibilities of the Department of Homeland Security regarding inadmissible and deportable aliens. The text chunk discusses the prohibition of sanctuary policies that violate Federal law or restrict compliance with Federal law by government entities or officials at the Federal, State, or local level. Compliance with Federal law is emphasized for States and political subdivisions. States with policies prohibiting law enforcement officers from assisting Federal immigration law enforcement will lose funding allocated under specific acts and programs. Annual determinations will be made regarding eligibility for funds. The Secretary of Homeland Security annually determines which States or political subdivisions are not compliant with immigration enforcement policies. Non-compliant jurisdictions are ineligible for federal financial assistance for at least one year. They can only regain eligibility after the Secretary certifies compliance. The Secretary of Homeland Security determines non-compliant jurisdictions annually. They lose federal funding and can regain eligibility after compliance certification. Unallocated funds are reallocated to compliant States or political subdivisions. States must provide information about apprehended aliens to the Secretary in a timely manner. The Secretary of Homeland Security must be provided with identifying information about inadmissible or deportable aliens in state custody. Non-compliant states are identified annually, and reimbursement is provided for costs incurred in providing this information. Law enforcement officials are not required to enforce this section. Law enforcement officials are required to provide information related to crime victims or witnesses to the Secretary of Homeland Security, or to report or arrest them.
